title: EONET Event Magnitudes
description: List of all the available event magnitudes in the EONET system

magnitudes.name: Acres
magnitudes.description: An area of land area equal to 4,840 square yards (0.405 hectare).

magnitudes.name: Hectares
magnitudes.description: A hectare is approximately equal to 2.471 acres.

magnitudes.name: Avg Max Windspeed (kts)
magnitudes.description: Average Max Sustained Winds reported for severe storms.

magnitudes.name: Body Wave Magnitude
magnitudes.description: Based on the amplitude of 1st arriving P-waves at periods of about 1 s. Reported for earthquakes that are observed teleseismically. Only authoritative for global seismicity for which there is no Mww, Mwc, Mwb or Mwr, typically 4.0-5.5 range.

magnitudes.name: Mi Integrated P-wave
magnitudes.description: Based on an estimate of moment calculated from the integral of the displacement of the P wave recorded on broadband instruments.

magnitudes.name: Richter Local Magnitude
magnitudes.description: The original magnitude relationship defined by Richter and Gutenberg in 1935 for local earthquakes. It is based on the maximum amplitude of a seismogram recorded on a Wood-Anderson torsion seismograph.

magnitudes.name: Moment Magnitude Scale
magnitudes.description: Moment magnitude scale (MMS) denoted as Mwâ€¯: measure of an earthquake.

magnitudes.name: Mwb Body Wave
magnitudes.description: Derived from moment tensor inversion of long-period body-waves. Generally computable for all M5.5 or larger events worldwide. Only authoritative if Mww and Mwc are not computed.

magnitudes.name: Mwc Centroid Moment Tensor
magnitudes.description: Derived from a centroid moment tensor inversion of the long-period surface waves (~100-2000 s; pass band based on size of EQ). Generally computable for all M6.0 worldwide using primarily the Global Seismograph Network. Only authoritative if Mww is not computed, not published otherwise.

magnitudes.name: Mwr Moment Tensor Inversion
magnitudes.description: Based on the scalar seismic-moment of the earthquake, derived from moment tensor inversion of the whole seismogram at regional distances. Authoritative for <M5.0.

magnitudes.name: Area (Nautical Miles)
magnitudes.description: Nautical miles squared used to approximate the area of icebergs.
